front.title: Dynamic Feature Extensions to the Presence Information Data Format Location Object (PIDF-LO)

abstract.t: The Geopriv Location Object introduced by the Presence Information Data Format - Location Object (PIDF-LO), RFC 4119, defines a basic XML format for carrying geographical information of a presentity. The PIDF-LO specification made a subset of the functionality offered by the Geography Markup Language (GML) standard 3.0 mandatory to implement. This document defines child elements to the <location- info> element specified in RFC 4119 to carry temporal feature elements useful for tracking moving objects. It defines five elements, namely speed, bearing, acceleration elevation and directionOfObject.
